document.docAuthor: Scarbrough, Aubrey G. & Perez-Gelabert, Daniel E.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the asilid (Diptera) fauna from Hispaniola with six genera new to the island, fifteen new species, and checklist

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the asilid (Diptera) fauna from Hispaniola with six genera new to the island, fifteen new species, and checklist

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ommatius hispaniolae
Scarbrough, 1984: 137
. Type locality: Barahona , Dominican Republic , holotype ♂ (MCZ); 1997: 13.

Distribution. Captured between sea level and 552 m in elevation during April, July- August, and December in Azua , Barahona , Independencia , Montecristi , Pedernales , Peravia , Santiago , San Cristóbal , and San Juan provinces. Vegetation zones include scattered scrub or pine in grassy areas, and deciduous forests.

Remarks. The largely pale hind tarsomere and terminalia ( Scarbrough, 1997 ) distinguishes
Ommatius hispaniolae
from congeners. This lowland species is usually one of the most abundant species in collections.
